summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between FBI personnel discussing a new victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves confirming the victim's status and requesting approval for counseling assistance through the EVAF (presumably a victim assistance fund).

persons.name: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Confirms that an individual is a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein in an email response.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: Requests confirmation about a new Epstein victim and inquires about approval for counseling sessions.

events.title: Initial Victim Assistance Request
events.description: An email is sent regarding a new Epstein victim requesting counseling assistance, with confirmation of her victim status sought.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

events.title: Victim Status Confirmation
events.description: An FBI Special Agent confirms that an individual is a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein, facilitating the approval process for counseling.
personsInvolved: Special Agent - FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: The FBI was actively processing new victim cases related to Jeffrey Epstein as of July 2020.
A victim assistance program (EVAF) was being utilized to provide counseling services (12 sessions) to confirmed victims.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between the Victim Services Division and the New York Field Office regarding victim confirmation and support.
